It’s a Saturday afternoon and James is bored at home. He has done all his homework and chores and now wants to go outside in the beautiful sunshine. He has decided he will go and see his friend Sarah and ask if she wants to go to the park together. James knocks on Sarah’s door and Sarah answers.
James and Sarah love playing sports in the park together. But they enjoy playing so many sports that Sarah doesn’t know which one James would like to play today.
“Excellent!”, says Sarah. She grabs her football from the shed, puts her trainers on and walks to the park with James. At this point Sarah notices a problem and has to stop. James asks what’s wrong?

Sarah ties her shoelaces so that she doesn’t trip and hurt herself. While Sarah is concentrating on tying her shoelaces, James sees a cool animal pass by him. He quickly tries to show Sarah but by the time she looks up, the animal has gone. “What kind of animal was it?”, asks Sarah.
“Wow! Cool! I wish I had seen it. What colour was the bird?” says Sarah.
James and Sarah reach the park and are talking about their favourite things about the park. Sarah says her favourite thing is:
James and Sarah start playing football and are having a great time. They play until James suddenly has to stop.

When James is finished on the phone he tells Sarah that it was his Dad, saying that dinner will be ready soon. “Ok, that’s cool.” says Sarah. But before they leave for home Sarah, hears something in the distance and wants to do something before they go home.
“Great, I’d love an ice cream!” says James. The pair get an ice cream from the van and walk home together after an excellent Saturday afternoon.

Jessica is going to see her Grandad today. She gets in the car with Mum and Dad and drives to her Grandad’s house in the village. Sometimes Grandad’s house can be a little boring so Jessica decides to take something with her to play with.

Mum, Dad and Jessica arrive at Grandad’s house. Jessica loves her Grandad but sometimes she gets worried about him, he is 87 years old after all (that’s 75 years older than Jessica!). When they arrive Grandad is outside but he doesn’t look very well. Jessica asks “What’s wrong?”

“Well I hope you get better”, says Jessica. “Oh I’ll be fine, I’ve been like this for years now”, Grandad laughs. Mum and Dad leave to go to the city and now it’s just Jessica and Grandad. It’s now the afternoon and Grandad would like to go the shops. “What are you going to buy”, asks Jessica.

They both go out to the shops and get all of Grandad’s items. It was cold outside so when they get back, Grandad and Jessica spend a long time taking off their jackets and gloves and scarves and hats and wellies and extra pairs of socks. They settle down in front of the fire with a hot chocolate. It’s still an hour until Mum and Dad come back so Jessica would like to do something before they pick her up.
Mum and Dad arrive to pick Jessica up. Jessica gives her Grandad a hug before she goes and then they head home.
